intro: Hieracium farinifolium, commonly known as the floury hawkweed, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its hairy, often grayish leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in meadows and grassy areas. Hieracium farinifolium is a perennial herb that thrives in temperate climates.
